Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; interior: reserved zone at top, black below added red band (possibly once framed by white lines) exterior: cream slip; tongues at top of shoulder; below, to left, part of asymmtrical palmette complex with red line on left section; to right, pendent roundel and dotted rosette.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see Cambridge NA28.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 7.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.106)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
